hints.label: rem-bombelli-sorkin-comparison
hints.title: Relation to Bombelli-Sorkin Results
hints.content:
1837: :label: rem-bombelli-sorkin-comparison
1838: 
1839: **Classical result** (Bombelli et al., 1987; Sorkin, 2003):
1840: 
1841: For **Poisson-sprinkled causal sets** on Lorentzian manifolds with **uniform sprinkling density**:
1842: 
1843: $$
1844: |\gamma_A| \to \text{Area}(\partial A_{\min}) \times (\text{const})
1845: $$
1846: 
1847: **Our result** ({prf:ref}`thm-antichain-surface-main` - corrected):
1848: 
1849: For **Fragile Gas causal spacetime tree** with **QSD density** $\rho_{\text{spatial}}(x) \propto \sqrt{\det g(x)} e^{-U_{\text{eff}}/T}$:
1850: 
1851: $$
1852: |\gamma_A| \to C_d N^{(d-1)/d} \int_{\partial A_{\min}} \left[\rho_{\text{spatial}}(x)\right]^{(d-1)/d} \, d\Sigma(x)
1853: $$
1854: 
1855: **Key differences**:
1856: 
1857: 1. **Dimensional correctness**: Scaling is $N^{(d-1)/d}$ (surface-like), not $N$ (volume-like)
1858: 2. **Non-uniform density**: QSD naturally incorporates $\sqrt{\det g}$ via Stratonovich calculus, with fractional power $(d-1)/d$
1859: 3. **Dynamical geometry**: Metric $g(x)$ emerges from algorithm (not fixed background)
1860: 4. **Interaction-dependent**: Fitness potential $U_{\text{eff}}$ modulates density
1861: 
1862: **Consistency check**: In the limit $U_{\text{eff}} \to \text{const}$ and $g \to I$ (flat Euclidean space), with uniform $\rho_0$:
1863: 
1864: $$
1865: |\gamma_A| \to C_d \rho_0^{(d-1)/d} N^{(d-1)/d} \, \text{Area}(\partial A_{\min})
1866: $$

hints.label: prop-area-law-varying-fitness
hints.title: Area Law for Non-Uniform Fitness
hints.content:
1874: :label: prop-area-law-varying-fitness
1875: 
1876: For spatially varying fitness $V_{\text{fit}}(x)$, the area law becomes:
1877: 
1878: $$
1879: S_{\text{IG}}(A) = \alpha \int_{\partial A_{\min}} e^{-U_{\text{eff}}(x)/T} \, d\Sigma_g(x)
1880: $$
1881: 
1882: where $\alpha$ is a constant determined by the algorithm parameters.
1883: 
1884: **Physical interpretation**: The effective area is **reduced** in high-fitness regions (low $U_{\text{eff}}$), where the swarm naturally explores more efficiently.
1885: 
1886: **Connection to holography**: This suggests a **position-dependent gravitational constant**:
1887: 
1888: $$
1889: \frac{1}{G_N(x)} \propto e^{-U_{\text{eff}}(x)/T}
1890: $$

hints.label: rem-error-bound-tightness
hints.title: Tightness of $O(N^{-1/d})$ Bound
hints.content:
1898: :label: rem-error-bound-tightness
1899: 
1900: The error bound $O(N^{-1/d})$ in {prf:ref}`thm-antichain-surface-main` is **optimal** for Voronoi-based discretizations:
1901: 
1902: - Lower bound from Voronoi cell size: $\Omega(N^{-1/d})$
1903: - Upper bound from concentration inequalities: $O(N^{-1/d})$
1904: 
1905: **Matching bounds** ⇒ The theorem is **rate-optimal**.
